title: Child shot at pee wee football game
content:
FORREST CITY, AR (WMC) -
According to Forrest City Police a 10-year-old boy was shot during a pee wee football game Saturday at 1:45 p.m.
Police said the boy has non life threatening injuries to his left foot.
"When he was really bleeding he told my son-in-law 'Daddy, daddy I'm going to die; I've been shot.' He said 'No son you're not going to die.'"
Dena Busby said her grandson McCoy Landsford was shot in the foot on Saturday while watching a pee wee football game in Forrest City, Arkansas.
"When my daughter called me I just screamed. She told me 'Mama calm down.' I just freaked out," Busby said.
She said Landsford is now at Le Bonheur Children's Hospital.
Police said they have one person of interest in this shooting, but no charges have been filed. They're investigating the incident as an accident.
"Why would a grown man have a gun where there is a bunch of children playing ball?" Busby said.
Busby is asking for people to pray for Landsford and she has one thing to say to parents.
"We just need to hold our children and always tell them we love them."
